question: For flight fuel of 2000 Kg calculated Dpnr = 500 nm. If Flight Fuel is increased by 200 Kg, Dpnr will be:
subject: Navigation

question: Full TAS 500 kt. Engine failure TAS 400 kt. Total distance 1000 nm. Along track wind component 40 kt. The distance to the engine failure CP will be:

choices.choice: 450nm
550nm
450 or 550nm depending on the wind direction

subject: Navigation

question: The distance to the PNR will be greatest:

choices.choice: If there is a tailwind component going out
If there is a headwind component going out
In still air conditions

subject: Navigation

question: An engine failure PNR is calculated to enable the pilot to make the correct decision in the event of:

choices.choice: An engine failing before reaching the mid-point
An engine failing after reaching the mi-point
the destination and its alternates closing any time up to the PNR

subject: Navigation

question: In flight it is discovered that the winds used have been reversal, the effect will be:

choices.choice: No effect on the distance to the PET but the ETA at it will be affected.
Change the distance tot he PNR
Give the distance of the PET from the base ahead instead of from the base behind.

subject: Navigation

question: Flight distance 1500nm, wind component out +40kt, back – 50kt, TAS 320kt, endurance – flight time +15%. The distance to the PNR will be:

choices.choice: 786nm
750nm
738nm

subject: Navigation

question: The effect of an increasing strength of wind at 90° to track on the time and distance to the PET will be:

choices.choice: Distance - none, time - increase
Distance - decrease, time - decrease
Distance - none, time - none

subject: Navigation

question: On a simple flight from A to B, the distance to the PET is 1200nm. The PNR endurance is equal to the flight time +10%. The distance to the PNR will be:

choices.choice: 1260nm provided the same winds apply to both PET and PNR calculations.
1320nm provided the same winds apply to both PET and PNR calculations
1320nm provided the wind is not at 90° the track

subject: Navigation

question: On a flight out to the PET, the GS are found to be less then expected. The PET will be moved along track:

choices.choice: Into wind
In to wind provided the wind change continues throughout the flight.
Downwind provided the wind changes continues throughout the flight.

subject: Navigation

question: For head wind component of 50 Kts calculated DCP is 750 nm for the total route dist of 1200 nm. In actual flight wind component is found to be 50 Kts of tail wind, new position of DCP will be:

choices.choice: 600 nm
450 nm
525 nm

subject: Navigation
